data.title: 200 Years Together - Missing Chapters
data.meta_description:
200 Years Together - Missing Chapters - Free ebook download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read book online for free. 1. In 1804, Tsar Alexander I established the first set of laws in Russia concerning Jews with the goal of improving their condition and directing them towards useful activities. The laws granted Jews equal civil rights and greater economic opportunities.

2. However, the laws mandated that Jews leave rural villages within three years and banned them from owning inns or distilling alcohol, their main livelihood. This was seen as cruel by Jews but the government argued it protected peasants. 

3. Due to practical difficulties in implementation, Alexander I postponed enforcing the rural relocation and alcohol bans multiple times over the next decade as he studied the issue further. The final resolution was delayed by the Napoleonic Wars.
